javax.swing

Class BufferStrategyPaintManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.RepaintManager.PaintManager
      • javax.swing.BufferStrategyPaintManager

  •  class BufferStrategyPaintManager
extends RepaintManager.PaintManager
    A PaintManager implementation that uses a BufferStrategy for rendering.
    Author:
    Scott Violet

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  BufferStrategyPaintManager.BufferInfo
      BufferInfo is used to track the BufferStrategy being used for a particular Component.

      • LOGGER

        private static final PlatformLogger LOGGER

      • bufferInfos

        private ArrayList<BufferStrategyPaintManager.BufferInfo> bufferInfos
        List of BufferInfos. We don't use a Map primarily because there are typically only a handful of top level components making a Map overkill.

      • painting

        private boolean painting
        Indicates beginPaint has been invoked. This is set to true for the life of beginPaint/endPaint pair.

      • showing

        private boolean showing
        Indicates we're in the process of showing. All painting, on the EDT, is blocked while this is true.

      • show

        public boolean show(Container c,
           int x,
           int y,
           int w,
           int h)
        Shows the specified region of the back buffer. This will return true if successful, false otherwise. This is invoked on the toolkit thread in response to an expose event.
        Overrides:
        show in class RepaintManager.PaintManager

            Graphics g,

        Description copied from class: RepaintManager.PaintManager
        Paints a region of a component
        Overrides:
        paint in class RepaintManager.PaintManager
        Parameters:
        paintingComponent - Component to paint
        bufferComponent - Component to obtain buffer for
        g - Graphics to paint to
        x - X-coordinate
        y - Y-coordinate
        w - Width
        h - Height
        Returns:
        true if painting was successful.

      • resetAccumulated

      • doubleBufferingChanged

        public void doubleBufferingChanged(JRootPane rootPane)
        Invoked when the double buffering or useTrueDoubleBuffering changes for a JRootPane. If the rootpane is not double buffered, or true double buffering changes we throw out any cache we may have.
        Overrides:
        doubleBufferingChanged in class RepaintManager.PaintManager

      • doubleBufferingChanged0

              boolean isPaint,

              int w,
              int h)
        Calculates information common to paint/copyArea.
        Returns:
        true if should use buffering per window in painting.
